availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Harlan, Jr. (Franklin County/Mercer County Lawyer/Politician)

body.p: Mercer County, Kentucky, attorney. Kentucky native. Son of James Harlan, Sr. and Eliza Harlan. Married to Amelia Harlan. Father of Henry Harlan. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from 1865 to 1866.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 2, p. 107.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Mercer County, Harrodsburg, p. 28.
The Louisville Daily Courier, "Letter from Anderson County", October 26, 1860, page 1.
The Courier-Journal, "Members of the House of Representatives," September 22, 1866, page 1.
Find A Grave, "James Harlan, Jr. (October 3, 1831-June 15, 1907)," Memorial #XXXXXXXX, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/ (accessed June x, 2018).
U.S. Find a Grave Index, 1600-Present, James Harlan Jr., https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=111927958&ref=acom accessed 03/15/2017.
